verses.verse: Hear<WH8085>, O Israel<WH3478>: Thou art to pass over<WH5674> Jordan<WH3383> this day<WH3117>, to go in<WH935> to possess<WH3423> nations<WH1471> greater<WH1419> and mightier<WH6099> than thyself, cities<WH5892> great<WH1419> and fenced up<WH1219> to heaven<WH8064>,

A people<WH5971> great<WH1419> and tall<WH7311>, the children<WH1121> of the Anakims<WH6062>, whom thou knowest<WH3045>, and of whom thou hast heard<WH8085> say, Who can stand<WH3320> before<WH6440> the children<WH1121> of Anak<WH6061>!

Understand<WH3045> therefore this day<WH3117>, that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> is he which goeth over<WH5674> before<WH6440> thee; as a consuming<WH398> fire<WH784> he shall destroy<WH8045> them, and he shall bring them down<WH3665> before thy face<WH6440>: so shalt thou drive them out<WH3423>, and destroy<WH6> them quickly<WH4118>, as the LORD<WH3068> hath said<WH1696> unto thee.

Speak<WH559> not thou in thine heart<WH3824>, after that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> hath cast them out<WH1920> from before<WH6440> thee, saying<WH559>, For my righteousness<WH6666> the LORD<WH3068> hath brought me in<WH935> to possess<WH3423> this land<WH776>: but for the wickedness<WH7564> of these nations<WH1471> the LORD<WH3068> doth drive them out<WH3423> from before<WH6440> thee.

Not for thy righteousness<WH6666>, or for the uprightness<WH3476> of thine heart<WH3824>, dost thou go<WH935> to possess<WH3423> their land<WH776>: but for the wickedness<WH7564> of these nations<WH1471> the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> doth drive them out<WH3423> from before<WH6440> thee, and that he may perform<WH6965> the word<WH1697> which the LORD<WH3068> sware<WH7650> unto thy fathers<WH1>, Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Jacob<WH3290>.

Understand<WH3045> therefore, that the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> giveth<WH5414> thee not this good<WH2896> land<WH776> to possess<WH3423> it for thy righteousness<WH6666>; for thou art a stiffnecked<WH6203><WH7186> people<WH5971>.

Â¶ Remember<WH2142>, and forget<WH7911> not, how thou provokedst the LORD<WH3068> thy God<WH430> to wrath<WH7107> in the wilderness<WH4057>: from<WH4480> the day<WH3117> that thou didst depart out<WH3318> of the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, until ye came<WH935> unto this place<WH4725>, ye have been rebellious<WH4784> against<WH5973> the LORD<WH3068>.
Also in Horeb<WH2722> ye provoked<WH7107> the LORD<WH3068> to wrath<WH7107>, so that the LORD<WH3068> was angry<WH599> with you to have destroyed<WH8045> you.

When I was gone up<WH5927> into the mount<WH2022> to receive<WH3947> the tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68>, even the tables<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285> which the LORD<WH3068> made<WH3772> with you, then I abode<WH3427> in the mount<WH2022> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, I neither did eat<WH398> bread<WH3899> nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>:

And the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> unto me two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68> written<WH3789> with the finger<WH676> of God<WH430>; and on them was written according to all the words<WH1697>, which the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH1696> with you in the mount<WH2022> out of the midst<WH8432> of the fire<WH784> in the day<WH3117> of the assembly<WH6951>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, that the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> me the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of stone<WH68>, even the tables<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285>.

And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto me, Arise<WH6965>, get thee down<WH3381> quickly<WH4118> from hence; for thy people<WH5971> which thou hast brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714> have corrupted<WH7843> themselves; they are quickly<WH4118> turned aside<WH5493> out of the way<WH1870> which I commanded<WH6680> them; they have made<WH6213> them a molten image<WH4541>.
Furthermore the LORD<WH3068> spake<WH559> unto me, saying<WH559>, I have seen<WH7200> this people<WH5971>, and, behold, it is a stiffnecked<WH6203><WH7186> people<WH5971>:

Let me alone<WH7503>, that I may destroy<WH8045> them, and blot out<WH4229> their name<WH8034> from under heaven<WH8064>: and I will make<WH6213> of<WH854> thee a nation<WH1471> mightier<WH6099> and greater<WH7227> than they.

So I turned<WH6437> and came down<WH3381> from the mount<WH2022>, and the mount<WH2022> burned<WH1197> with fire<WH784>: and the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871> of the covenant<WH1285> were in my two<WH8147> hands<WH3027>.

And I looked<WH7200>, and, behold, ye had sinned<WH2398> against the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and had made<WH6213> you a molten<WH4541> calf<WH5695>: ye had turned aside<WH5493> quickly<WH4118> out of the way<WH1870> which the LORD<WH3068> had commanded<WH6680> you.
And I took<WH8610> the two<WH8147> tables<WH3871>, and cast<WH7993> them out of<WH5921> my two<WH8147> hands<WH3027>, and brake<WH7665> them before your eyes<WH5869>.

And I fell down<WH5307> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>, as at the first<WH7223>, forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>: I did neither eat<WH398> bread<WH3899>, nor drink<WH8354> water<WH4325>, because of all your sins<WH2403> which ye sinned<WH2398>, in doing<WH6213> wickedly<WH7451> in the sight<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>, to provoke him to anger<WH3707>.

For I was afraid<WH3025> of<WH6440> the anger<WH639> and hot displeasure<WH2534>, wherewith the LORD<WH3068> was wroth<WH7107> against you to destroy<WH8045> you. But the LORD<WH3068> hearkened<WH8085> unto me at that time<WH6471> also.
And the LORD<WH3068> was very<WH3966> angry<WH599> with Aaron<WH175> to have destroyed<WH8045> him: and I prayed<WH6419> for Aaron<WH175> also the same time<WH6256>.

And I took<WH3947> your sin<WH2403>, the calf<WH5695> which ye had made<WH6213>, and burnt<WH8313> it with fire<WH784>, and stamped<WH3807> it, and ground<WH2912> it very small<WH3190>, even until it was as small<WH1854> as dust<WH6083>: and I cast<WH7993> the dust<WH6083> thereof into the brook<WH5158> that descended out<WH3381> of the mount<WH2022>.
And at Taberah<WH8404>, and at Massah<WH4532>, and at Kibroth-hattaavah<WH6914>, ye provoked the LORD<WH3068> to wrath<WH7107>.

Likewise when the LORD<WH3068> sent<WH7971> you from Kadesh-barnea<WH6947>, saying<WH559>, Go up<WH5927> and possess<WH3423> the land<WH776> which I have given<WH5414> you; then ye rebelled<WH4784> against the commandment<WH6310> of the LORD<WH3068> your God<WH430>, and ye believed<WH539> him not, nor hearkened<WH8085> to his voice<WH6963>.
Ye have been rebellious<WH4784> against the LORD<WH3068> from the day<WH3117> that I knew<WH3045> you.

Thus I fell down<WH5307> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> forty<WH705> days<WH3117> and forty<WH705> nights<WH3915>, as I fell down<WH5307> at the first; because the LORD<WH3068> had said<WH559> he would destroy<WH8045> you.

I prayed<WH6419> therefore unto the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, O Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>, destroy<WH7843> not thy people<WH5971> and thine inheritance<WH5159>, which thou hast redeemed<WH6299> through thy greatness<WH1433>, which thou hast brought forth<WH3318> out of Egypt<WH4714> with a mighty<WH2389> hand<WH3027>.

Remember<WH2142> thy servants<WH5650>, Abraham<WH85>, Isaac<WH3327>, and Jacob<WH3290>; look<WH6437> not unto the stubbornness<WH7190> of this people<WH5971>, nor to their wickedness<WH7562>, nor to their sin<WH2403>:

Lest the land<WH776> whence thou broughtest us out<WH3318> say<WH559>, Because the LORD<WH3068> was not able<WH3201> to bring<WH935> them into the land<WH776> which he promised<WH1696> them, and because he hated<WH8135> them, he hath brought them out<WH3318> to slay<WH4191> them in the wilderness<WH4057>.
Yet they are thy people<WH5971> and thine inheritance<WH5159>, which thou broughtest out<WH3318> by thy mighty<WH1419> power<WH3581> and by thy stretched out<WH5186> arm<WH2220>.
